wait wait WAIT...what program/site are you using to translate?
Translate that Seinan War newspaper article on 3-hajime/1to5.net
please....
I still can't quiet understand the replies to my messages on 
http://www.3-hajime.com/cgi-local/patio/patio.cgi?mode=view&no=16
and 
http://www.tamahito.com/whoswho.htm (which mentions ANOTHER Saitou
Hajime in the Shinsengumi)
does it REALLY say that Nakajima Nobori grew orchids?  Or is it his
wife's name or something...it is in the same sentence talking about
his firearms shop.  This detail interests me because orchids are very
hard to cultivate ^_^ you really have to have a green thumb to have
them grow successfully.
All of this info really makes things even more intriguing ... because
you may have already read that Saitou was -sent- to Aizu with a couple
of guys ahead of time...because there were battles at Aizu with many
members of the Shinsengumi (Nakajima Nobori included) we have
rosters...there was another Japanese site that said Shimada Kai was
thick necked this no doubt means that he was "buff".  It is
unfortunate, but people can change for better or worst...in the case
of Kondo, his story was a true rags to riches/power scenario and this
probably resulted in the clash with other managment level guys.  The
situation was so critical and stress levels must've been
high...dissent is normal when it comes to important tactical decisions.

I also posted a question in English to a member of the 3-hajime.com
board, his/her name is "Passenger", about the whole business with the
towel.

Wow, I wonder if Miki tracked down Nagakura...what made them stop
fighting...

I'm impressed with Shimada Kai...have you guys seen how fancy Japanese
Buddhist altars can get?  Some altars are HUGE...I'm happy that he had
a nice and peaceful job.
